history.content:
After receiving an A in CS189, I took EE127 last semester but it didn't go well for me. The grade distribution of EE127 last semester has defied the record on berkelytime and became pretty harsh. While the staff claimed that 1 std is "more than enough to get an A", according to a classmate on piazza having 1 std on midterm, final and HW will still only got A-. I also know a friend who got an A+ in CS189 received an A- in EE127.

If you only concern AI/ML, I would say the materials of CS 189 and EE127 are quite overlapped. The first half of EE127 is linear algebra and linear regression you've seen in CS189. The second half is about linear programming(LP), quadratic programming(QP), second-order conic programming(SOCP) and duality. If you have taken CS189, you should be familiar with most of the concepts in EE127, but beware that EE127 is more about solving problems than simply understanding the math. Many problems in EE127 will need some creative mathematical tricks.

I personally think that EE127 is harder than CS189, and doing well in CS189 does not guarantee your success in EE127. Also, I took CS162 and CS 161 in the same semester and based on my experience, these two courses are heavy enough. I guess you should better take some easier classes?

While the staff claimed that 1 std is "more than enough to get an A", according to a classmate on piazza having 1 std on midterm, final and HW will still only got A-. I also know a friend who got an A+ in CS189 received an A- in EE127.

If you only concern AI/ML, I would say the materials of CS 189 and EE127 are quite overlapped. The first half of EE127 is linear algebra and linear regression you've seen in CS189. The second half is about linear programming(LP), quadratic programming(QP), second-order conic programming(SOCP) and duality. If you have taken CS189, you should be familiar with most of the concepts in EE127, but beware that EE127 is more about solving problems than simply understanding the math. Many problems in EE127 will need some creative mathematical tricks.

I personally think that EE127 is harder than CS189, and doing well in CS189 does not guarantee your success in EE127. Also, I took CS162 and CS 161 in the same semester and based on my experience, these two courses are heavy enough to send you to depression. I guess you should better take some easier classes?

children.subject: 127 tests your LA knowledge as well as your ability to cast situations into different models and to prove equivalences of different formulations. imo that's a different skillset than what you needed to succeed in 189.

history.content: Hi, I’m debating whether or not to take EE127 and I would like some advice. I took CS189 last semester and really enjoyed the linear algebra/optimization part of it. How hard is EE127 in comparison to CS189 and how much overlap is there (will it be easier since I already took 189 and understood all the math pretty well)? I am planning on taking CS162 and possibly CS161 or Data 100 this semester so I don’t think I can afford to take a class that is super time consuming. For people who’ve taken both courses, do you think I would be able to handle adding 127? Thanks!
history.subject: EE127 after taking CS189
